subject: Re: FW: Poultry HQ: WooCommerce + Xero Intregration
preview: Hi  Have you found a solution to input previous home delivery invoices into XERO.  Ill need them input by Monday as its EOFY.  Haris moutzouris   phone  (03) 5926 0729  website  http://www.poultryhq.c

full_threads.body:
Hi

Have you found a solution to input previous home delivery invoices into XERO.

Ill need them input by Monday as its EOFY.

Haris
moutzouris

phone

(03) 5926 0729

website

http://www.poultryhq.com.au/

address

Building 2, 109-111 Craig Rd, Devon Meadows, Vic, 3977

Hi Haris,

We’ve disabled the Amaka integration for now.

We can do a trial run with Cindy's suggestion.

Here’s the setup works at the moment:
  • When an order is placed, it is automatically sent to your Xero account and saved as a Draft invoice (Business > Invoices > Draft).
  • You may need to manually update the invoice in Xero once you've confirmed payment in Stripe.
We can also add a trigger to automatically update Xero when the WooCommerce order status is set to Complete, if you'd prefer that workflow.

Regarding the invoice number:
With the Zapier integration, we were able to configure it so that the WooCommerce order number is used as the invoice number in Xero.

action.text: Cindy Valderama assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi,

Orders coming in are still marking themselves as paid..

I need to be able to reconcile from the stripe payments.

Also is there a way that when WooCommerce sends the order to Xero it uses the order dumber as the invoice rather than allocating an invoice number so it is easier to reconcile correctly.

What other option are there?

I need the orders to come in as the order number and be able to reconcile from the stripe payments without Xero showing as paid.

Haris
moutzouris

phone

(03) 5926 0729

website

http://www.poultryhq.com.au/

address

Building 2, 109-111 Craig Rd, Devon Meadows, Vic, 3977

Hi Haris.

It appears that the current integration doesn't fully meet your expectations, so we've opted to use a Zapier integration instead.
Here’s how the setup works at the moment:
  • When an order is placed, it is automatically sent to your Xero account and saved as a Draft invoice.
  • You may need to manually update the invoice in Xero once you've confirmed payment in Stripe.

We can also add a trigger to automatically update Xero when the WooCommerce order status is set to Complete, if you'd prefer that workflow.

As for syncing previous WooCommerce orders to Xero, we’ll be using a direct import approach. This may consume time, as we’ll need to map the exported data from WooCommerce to match Xero’s import template accurately.

Please let us know if this setup for creating new orders via the integration works for you, or if you'd like to adjust anything.

action.text: Cindy Valderama assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
How do we get around WooCommerce and in turn Xero marketing the payments as paid?

We need to be able to reconcile otherwise if it shows as paid and we have funds coming in from without being able to allocate them anywhere…

We need a solution.

Haris
moutzouris

phone

(03) 5926 0729

website

http://www.poultryhq.com.au/

address

Building 2, 109-111 Craig Rd, Devon Meadows, Vic, 3977

Hi Haris.

Upon checking, we found that the latest order used the Afterpay payment method instead of Stripe. It appears that Afterpay also processes payments through Stripe.

We’ve now updated the conditional statement to apply the surcharge to the Afterpay payment gateway as well.

This change ensures that the surcharge will now be added to both Stripe and Afterpay payment methods.

Client's reply @joel

Okay
So now that ive unallocated the payment i should be able to reconcile when the funds from stripe are available?
But why hasn't the customer been charged the stripe fee?

action.text: Cindy Valderama assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body: @joel closing the other task. Let's update the client here moving forward. Thanks!

Hi Haris.

We've looked into this, and it appears that the payment status is being determined based on WooCommerce, not when Stripe actually receives the payment. Since the customer used Stripe, WooCommerce marked the status as "Paid," which in turn caused Xero to also record it as "Paid."

As for syncing the orders to Xero, it seems we may need to do this manually for now. However, we're still exploring free plugin options that could automate the process and save time.

We'll keep you updated on our progress.

Thank you!

Hi Haris.

After reviewing the Amaka integration, we noted that three syncs have been successful so far. However, the latest order placed on June 13 has not yet synced to Xero.

We're currently operating under the assumption that syncing only occurs for completed orders. This can likely be confirmed once the order is marked as completed. Since the delivery date is set for June 19, we'll continue monitoring to see if it syncs after that point.

If this integration does not meet our needs, we may consider switching to a Zapier integration, which offers more advanced setup options. Please note that Zapier is a paid solution, and we wanted to give you a heads-up about that potential cost.

Additionally, could you please confirm whether you'd like us to sync previous orders to Xero, or if the integration should only apply to new orders moving forward?

In the meantime, we'll continue to monitor the current sync setup this week and will keep you updated.

We'll be monitoring the sync process, which is scheduled to begin tomorrow, to ensure everything runs smoothly.

If you have any questions or need assistance, feel free to reach out.

Thanks!

Hi Haris.

We're currently in the process of integrating Xero with your WooCommerce store. As part of this setup, we've created a temporary account under our email using Amaka - the third-party tool that facilitates the connection between the two platforms.

To proceed, we need access to your Xero account to complete the integration. Are you able to provide your Xero login credentials for this purpose?

If you prefer not to share your login details, no problem - we can instead provide you with the Amaka account credentials along with a step-by-step guide so you can connect your Xero account directly.

Please let us know how you'd like to proceed.
